channel.title: Open Topic (new posts)
channel.description: Posts in the forum category "Open Topic" - Discuss anything!

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Just looked at the test page, looks much improved. It's currently lacking the big "Welcome to this Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition wiki" thing at the top, I assume that's unintentional?

If I had to make a change to the current test page lineage section, I'd add an extra line break before both "Setting Specific" and "Custom" (and maybe UA as well, for consistency) to set them more apart. It'd set them more apart, and we have the space for it. But, overall, super nice work. This is much better than the current home page.

EDIT: Oh, and you're missing Spelljammer under setting specific! And I suppose dragonlance as well, since the Kender page is now up?

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Take a look at the test page, let me know what you think, I reset it back to 3 columns and moved the Setting Specific, Custom, & Unearthed Arcana to the same column as the Monstrous.

As for the wrong icon for the races… yeah, that wasn't intentional lol. It should be fixed now.

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
I don't understand how to get to the basic races from the home page.

On the homepage, scroll down or click "races" to go to the lineage section. From there, click "Common" to go to a list of common lineages, which includes Human, Elf, and Dwarf.

On that note, it's a bit odd that the race/lineage section on the homepage uses the artificer's gears icon instead of the "people" icon that the race section used before, and still uses at the top of the page. Is that intentional, Fredbob? Seems a bit of an odd choice to me.

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
I don't understand how to get to the basic races from the home page. When I click "Races" none of the links in that section lead to entries about basic Dwarf, Elf, Human, etc. It's all just custom lineages.

I was able to find the Dwarf page (for example) via Google search, but as best I can tell you can't get there from the home page.

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Unless there are objections to the widening of the content space on the main page

Was just about to bring that up, actually. Changing the entire width of the front page for this seems a bit odd. With the length of the Exotic column, I think it'd be easy to fit Setting Specific, Custom, and UA under Monstrous. That way, I'm pretty sure the width would be the same as the current homepage, and the length wouldn't get any longer since Exotic is already longer than those categories combined.

Thanks again for your help with this, Fredbob.

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
I moved 'Custom' to just above 'Unearthed Arcana', that does look better, thanks for the suggestion.

I tried the table concept, and it just doesn't really fit on the main page. Mainly because the simple table (using the '||' to create the table) has no way of removing the lines between rows. Since we don't have those anywhere else on the main page it looks kind of out of place. Our only other option would be advanced tables (essentially html). And while I can do that, it'd take a little while and make maintaining those lists a harder because it's a lot more code and making sure you've got all the opening and closing tags lined up. Especially since we keep things alphabetical and so we insert in the middle of lists sometimes.

Unless there are objections to the widening of the content space on the main page. I think what we have on that test page is what we'll go with on the main page.

item.title: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen: Re: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen
item.content:encoded: Just finished adding all the new content and updating the relevant pages.

item.title: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen: Re: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen
item.content:encoded: Woah, nice work!

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Looks awesome! I second moving Custom to the end of the third column though as well, even just as 'Custom Lineage'. Other than that, that is beautiful!

EDIT: Another option instead of widening the page to do four columns, is to lengthen it going down the page, similarly to what was there before but originally in two columns — something like below or even doing the left "column" going down like this and the right column with the way it is?

Common

Dragonborn Dwarf Elf
Gnome Half-Elf Halfling
Half-Orc Human Tiefling

Exotic

item.title: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors: Re: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors
item.content:encoded:
I'm seeing 502 errors on many pages - about 20% of the time I try to load anything. It's not consistent.

I found that if I clear my cache, the affected page will load immediately with no problems.

item.title: Broken Links: Broken Links
item.content:encoded:
I use this site a lot during character creation but recently I keep getting 502 errors on random pages. To combat this I took a mirror of the entire site so I can load the missing pages locally. In the process of changing the links on the mirrored pages to redirect to my other local pages I discovered a few mistyped or otherwise broken links.

[artificer] "spells:cure-wounds" should be "spell:cure-wounds"
[artificer:armorer-ua] "spell:greater-invisibilty" should be "spell:greater-invisibility"
[background:gruul-anarch] "spell:dominante-beast" should be "spell:dominate-beast"
[background:sword-coast-heroic-chronicle] "background:Cloistered" should be "background:cloistered-scholar"
[background:sword-coast-heroic-chronicle] "background:spy" should be "background:criminal#toc1"
[epic-boons] "spells:plane-shift" should be "spell:plane-shift"
[fighter:monster-hunter-ua] "spelldetect-magic" should be "spell:detect-magic"
[lineage:kalashtar] "dream" should be "spell:dream" x2
[lineage:kalashtar] "sleep" should be "spell:sleep" x2
[sorcerer:clockwork-soul-ua] "spell:protection-from-good-and-evil" should be "spell:protection-from-evil-and-good" (link text wrong too)
[supernatural-gifts] "piety" (missing page?)
[warlock:celestial-ua] "spell:buuning-hands" should be "spell:burning-hands"
[warlock:ghost-in-the-machine-ua] "spell:haywire" should be "spell:haywire-ua"
[wizard:artificer-ua:magic-item-tables] "wondrous-items:dust-of-dissapearance" should be "wondrous-items:dust-of-disappearance" (link text wrong too)
[wizard:artificer-ua:magic-item-tables] "wondrous-items:goggle-of-night" should be "wondrous-items:goggles-of-night" (link text wrong too)
[wizard:artificer-ua:magic-item-tables] "wondrous-items:Potion-of-greater-healing" should be "wondrous-items:potion-of-healing"
[wondrous-items:all] "wondrous-items:shield" (missing page?)
[wondrous-items:cauldron-of-rebirth] "wondrous-items:potion-of-greater-healing" should be "wondrous-items:potion-of-healing"
[wondrous-items:demonomicon-of-iggwilv] "wondrous-items:fraz-urbluus-staff" (missing page?)
[wondrous-items:the-infernal-machine-of-lum-the-mad] "spell:conjure-minor-elemental" should be "spell:conjure-minor-elementals" (link text wrong too)

Hope this is helpful and thank you to everyone who contributes to this site.

item.title: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded: Looks great! Personally, I'd move the "Custom" link to the very end instead of the very start, as right now it kind of looks like it says "Custom Common" or something, but apart from that, it's much better!

item.title: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors: Re: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors
item.content:encoded: I'm getting a ton of these now too! Random stuff from certain wizard spells to weapons, then druid spells will work fine.

item.title: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists: Re: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists
item.content:encoded:
We could do that for spells that came out with Tasha's, but Tasha's also expanded the spell lists of classes with spells that were released in earlier books, including from the PHB.

For example, Teleportation Circle is from the PHB, but got added to the warlock spell list by Tasha's.

We obviously shouldn't mark that spell as a Tasha's spell, but we don't have a way to mark it only for the warlock spell list. It's just a limitation of how we've got this set up right now. And again, I'm just not sure how we'd do it, unless we set up a separate page for each spell for each class that has access to it.

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
So something like this?
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/home:test

item.title: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors: Re: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors
item.content:encoded: I am seeing the same thing constantly on the backrooms Wikidot too and it is very frustrating as I'm trying to read it and at one second it just does the error. And some are extremely bad like Level 600 constantly does the error 24/7 and only works every little second.

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
About the only compromise type of edit that I can think of is to list just the Standard lineages and the Monstrous races; and then have page redirects for the setting-specific lineages or something

Exotic ones too, but yes, I agree here. Setting specific / UA absolutely does not need to be on the front page, but I'd very much like the others.

item.title: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists: Re: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists
item.content:encoded: Is it not possible to treat Tasha's as a new category — like how you can click to view all spells by school, or all ritual spells, regardless of class?? And then just create a superscript for it on the individual spell pages that just lets players know 'hey, this spell is a Tasha's spell'?

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Sorry for slow reply — there isn't any sort of notification system about these forums or a link to jump here so I had to Google to get back here lol

Yes, it had been a while since I checked the Aasimar page - at the time of my last checking, it was missing its base level information (age, alignment, etc) for its uppermost section; and only had the new revised information. If that has been fixed, I haven't checked lately and I apologize for that.

I suppose I can kind of see where you're coming from with the race list getting expansive, but I guess I'm just a weird one that prefers one page that has links instead of having to click into two or three pages to get where I want to go. Same with if the Backgrounds and Feats section get collapsed into page hops too. I don't think there's really a way to compromise between the two, honestly, unless you have a way to expand the content container of the main page to be wider so you could have more columns across and shorter column lists.

About the only compromise type of edit that I can think of is to list just the Standard lineages and the Monstrous races; and then have page redirects for the setting-specific lineages or something — that way at least the most commonly used races are available straight from the main page without extra hops.

I can't comment on the discussion - I only recently actually created an account for the wikidot website, so I wasn't able to view any history of edits or anything until just a little while back.
